newsitem.title: UK: OPTIONS-Gas active on lingering merger talk.
newsitem.headline: OPTIONS-Gas active on lingering merger talk.

text.p: Activity in British Gas options were active again on Tuesday amid lingering talk of a takeover or merger, dealers said.
Heavy options trading was ignited yesterday on the back of reports that Shell Transport had approached British Gas with a merger proposal.
Though the rally in British Gas shares has decelerated, options activity remained brisk, they said.
"There's still a lot of speculation about a takeover," said one dealer. "Most of these (options) deals seem to be speculative."
The shares were up 2-1/2p to 231p on heavy volume of 21.6 million shares at 1403 GMT. They jumped 19-1/2p yesterday.

Most of the options volume was in the December 240 calls, where almost 1,100 lots traded. Volume in British Gas, 2-1/2 hours before the close, totalled almost 4,700, with call volume outpacing put volume by a margin of about two to one.
Dealers noted the purchase of 3,000 June 100 calls in Tarmac at 5p. Tarmac shares, down 1/2p at 88p, need to rise by more than 19 percent before December expiry to show a profit.
Trading in Vodafone options heated up after the company posted profits at the top end of analysts' forecasts.

The mobile 'phone concern also said it had not been approached it by U.S. telecommunications giant AT&T Corp about a merger or takeover as had been rumoured several weeks ago. Vodafone also said it was buying Peoples Phone Plc.

Option volume was heaviest in the Vodafone's November 240 calls, where about 700 lots changed hands. The November 240 puts registered volume of 400 lots, and the January 240 puts saw volume of more than 300 lots. Vodafone shares were 7-1/2p higher at 251p, the highest level since early June.
November equity option expire on the LIFFE tomorrow.
